Package com.example.pokedex.pruebas.controllers

Class PokemonListController

java.lang.Object
com.example.pokedex.pruebas.controllers.PokemonListController
@RestController @RequestMapping(path="/api") public class PokemonListController extends Object
This class acts as the controller for this application.
Author:
Alejandro Laso

  • Method Details

    • getList

      @GetMapping(path="/list") public PokeResponse getList()
      Method used to get a standard list of Pokemon, with default values provided by the original API
      Returns:
      PokeResponse containing the list of Pokemon

    • getLimitedList

      @GetMapping(path="/limitlist") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PokeResponse> getLimitedList(@RequestParam Integer limit, @RequestParam Integer offset)
      Method to retrieve a list of Pokemon with the indicated amount of Pokemon you want and with an offset of your choice
      Parameters:
      limit - Number of Pokemon you want to retrieve in the search
      offset - Starting number of the Pokemon to retrieve from the API
      Returns:
      PokeResponse containing the list of Pokemon

    • getOptionalList

      @GetMapping(path="/optionallist") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<PokeResponse> getOptionalList(@RequestParam Integer totalToGet, @RequestParam(defaultValue="0") Integer offset)
      Method to retrieve a certain amount of Pokemon, by making the necessary calls to the API with a default limit of 20 each time
      Parameters:
      totalToGet - Number of total Pokemon you want to retrieve from the API
      offset - Starting number of the Pokemon to retrieve from the API
      Returns:
      PokeResponse containing the list of Pokemon
